entries.title: Canada to Facilitate Cameroon Peace Process: Foreign Affairs Minister Joly
entries.description: Canada's Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly arrives for the first day of the meeting of NATO Ministers of Foreign Affairs in Bucharest, Romania, Nov. 29, 2022. (The Canadian Press/AP-Andreea Alexandru)

entries.title: Ontario Doctors Critical COVID Policies Rejected by Medical College in Their Motion to Stop Disciplinary Hearings
entries.description: A health worker draws out Moderna vaccine during a drive-through COVID-19 vaccine clinic at St. Lawrence College in Kingston, Ont., on Jan. 2, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Lars Hagberg)

entries.title: Cory Morgan: Trudeau’s Surprise Position on Provincial Health-Care Initiatives Is Welcome
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Premier Doug Ford tour the General Motors CAMI assembly plant in Ingersoll, Ont., on Dec. 5, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Nicole Osborne)

entries.title: Sri Lanka Secures India’s Support for IMF Deal, China’s Approval Pending
entries.description:
Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe (R), shakes hands with 
India’s Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar (L), in Colombo, Sri Lanka, on Jan. 20, 2023. (Sri Lankan President's Office via AP)

entries.title: Djibouti Signs Deal With Hong Kong Company to Build Rocket Launch Site
entries.description: Djibouti's President Ismail Omar Guelleh during an interview with AFP at the State House Djibouti on May 6, 2015. (Carl de Souza/AFP/Getty Images)

entries.title: UK Conservative Party Chairman Zahawi Says Tax Error ‘Careless and Not Deliberate’
entries.description: Conservative Party chairman Nadhim Zahawi leaves after attending the weekly Cabinet meeting at 10 Downing Street, in London, on Jan. 10, 2023. (Daniel Leal/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Japan Plans to Downgrade COVID-19 to ‘Seasonal Flu’ Status, Evolve From Pandemic-Era Mandates
entries.description: Japan's Minister of Health, Labour, and Welfare Katsunobu Kato, wearing a face mask, speaks during a budget committee meeting at the lower house of parliament on April 28, 2020 in Tokyo, Japan. (Tomohiro Ohsumi/Getty Images)

entries.title: UK’s Sunak Fined by Police for Failing to Wear Seatbelt in Social Media Video
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visits Accrington Market Hall, in Accrington, Lancashire, England, on Jan. 19, 2023. (Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

entries.title: Four Canadian Men Held in Syrian Camps Entitled to Repatriation by Ottawa: Judge
entries.description: A general view of Karma camp for in internally displaced Syrians, Feb. 14, 2022 by the village of Atma, Idlib Prince, Syria. (The Canadian Press/AP-Omar Albam)

entries.title: Peter Menzies: Ottawa’s Speech-Restricting Legislation Built on Same Foundation That Aims to Silence Peterson, Rowling
entries.description: Jordan Peterson and J.K. Rowling. (The Canadian Press/Jason Franson; Angela Weiss/AFP/Getty Images)

entries.title: Labour Calls for UK Conservative Party Chairman Zahawi to Be Sacked Over Tax Claims
entries.description: Nadhim Zahawi, Conservative Party chairman and minister without portfolio, arrives at 10 Downing Street for a Cabinet meeting, in London, on Nov. 29, 2022. (Leon Neal/Getty Images)

entries.title: Former SEAL Dies in Ukraine; 6th Known American Killed in War
entries.description: A woman stands in front of a display of destroyed Russian tanks and armoured vehicles in downtown Kyiv, Ukraine, on Jan. 20, 2023. (Daniel Cole/AP Photo)

entries.title: Chris Hipkins Nominated to Succeed New Zealand’s PM Jacinda Ardern
entries.description: The then-New Zealand COVID-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins addresses a press conference at Parliament in Wellington, New Zealand on Oct. 11, 2021. (Robert Kitchin/Pool Photo via AP)

entries.title: Defense Chiefs Fail to Resolve Dispute on Tanks for Ukraine
entries.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin (L) and the Ukrainian participant Oleksii Reznikov (R) attend the meeting of the 'Ukraine Defense Contact Group' at Ramstein Air Base in Ramstein, Germany, on Jan. 20, 2023. (Michael Probst/AP Photo)

entries.title: Farmers Fight on After Floods in Australian State
entries.description: Floodwaters linger near Kerang, Victoria ahead of further rain forecast for the weekend, Nov. 12, 2022.  (AAP Image/Brendan McCarthy)

entries.title: Paper-Thin Supply Sparks Australian School Books Fear
entries.description: Test scores in our elementary and secondary schools are either stagnant or falling. (Syda Productions/Shutterstock)

entries.title: PREMIERING 1/21 at 7:30pm ET: Lech Walesa: ‘Communism’s Days Are Numbered Wherever It Exists’
entries.description: Lech Walesa: ‘Communism’s Days Are Numbered Wherever It Exists’

entries.title: Shining Light on New Treatment for Antibiotic Resistant Superbugs
entries.description: In this file image an agar plate of the superbug Staphylcocus epidermidis is examined in Melbourne on Sept. 4, 2018. (William West/AFP/Getty Images)

entries.title: Woodside Energy Denies Withholding Gas Supply Amid Complaints From Consumer Groups and Politicians
entries.description: Safety flares are shown at the Woodside operated North West Shelf Gas Venture in Western Australia, on June 17, 2008. (Greg Wood/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Alberta Premier Responds to Allegations of Staffer Contacting Prosecutors on Group Charged at Coutts Blockade
entries.description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith gives an Alberta government update in Calgary, Alta., on Jan. 10, 2023. (Jeff McIntosh/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: More Cash but Australian Schools Don’t Make the Grade
entries.description: School students arrive for the first day of face-to-face schooling in Brisbane, Australia, May 11, 2020. (AAP Image/Dan Peled)

entries.title: Aussie GPs Blast ‘Out-of-Control’ Pharmacists
entries.description: Pharmacists working in the Life Pharmacy on March 19, 2020. (Niall Carson/PA Media)

entries.title: Australians Return to Capital Cities After Lockdowns, Driving Rental Competition
entries.description: A new development is advertised for lease in Melbourne, Australia, on Sept. 4, 2018. (William West/AFP via Getty Images)
